titles: Merry iests, concerning popes, monkes, and friers Whereby is discouered their abuses and errors &c. Written first in Italian by N.S. and thence translated into French by G.I. and now out of French into English, by R.W. Bac. of Arts of H.H. in Oxon.
author: N. S., fl. 1617.
Willet, Roland, b. 1588 or 9.
notes: "The translator to the reader" is signed: Rowland Willet.
A translation of a French translation of an unidentified Italian original.
Running title reads: Merry iests concerning popes munkes & friers.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Catholic Church --  Clergy --  Humor --  Early works to 1800.
Catholic Church --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
